title: Tankiest champ
body:

So, which champion is the tankiest in the game>?

It's easily Alistar. His R gives him an absurd amount of DR, no other champ even comes close to 70% DR. Just to give some idea of how good that is at 200 armour 70% DR is worth the equivalent of 710 extra armour that can't be penned through by anything but true damage. Also due to the way that armour and DR interact as you buy more armour the DR becomes worth more equivalent armour, for example at 300 it's worth 933 armour equivalent.

When you consider that the next best is either Braum with 40% DR or Rammus with 120 armour/MR Alistar is just miles ahead of them.

If you're facing an AD heavy team then Maplhite is close to the top as well because of his absurd % armor bonus and passive shield, which makes any defensive item he gains exponentially stronger since it multiplies both stats very effectively.

Also, Cho'gath with his new ult can become far tankier than you'd imagine possible and scales indefinitely. I've seen people top out well above 10,000 HP, with enough resists to match. Only Vayne can deal with that within reason.

Tahm is definitely one of the top three, alongside Alistar and probably Darius. New Sejuani and a Cho/Sion with Stoneplate probably are in there too.

Tahm possesses a unique 'burst tank,' where his grey health can effectively double his health if he's clever with the usage and enemies are unfortunate enough to focus him that consistently.

I've always stood by Leona-- defense stim, two stuns, good engage. Generally speaking, there will probably be more rules and exceptions than not, but I've never felt like Leona isn't at least a competent enough tank in her right.

But I mean in the same way, Graves is hella tanky versus AD these days, while AD also benefits from a lot of MR/dmg builds, so there's potential there. And he can better activate lifesteal and such. There's also Nautilus and Sion, with scaling health shields. Braum possesses very easily-accessed hard damage reduction, as does Warwick.

Like if you had all the tanks, and you had a full build adc try and kill each one of them, who would last the longest.

you cant compare champions like that. the stats in this game are too varied. that's why you both have different opinions. to your friend raw hp might be what makes a tank. to you it might be something like spell shields and basic attacks. vayne for example is strong against pure hp builds. mundo has some amazing regeneration and his stats scale from HP so he can do damage while just building pure hp, but if he goes against vayne he's instantly wiped off the field. zac has regeneration and all of his ability scale from AP while being almost resourceless just like mundo. 

you have to specify your scenario.

the best generalist tank is sion. the best damage mitigation tank is alistar. the best aura tank is amumu, the best distraction tank is singed. the best harassment tank is nautilus, the best damage soak tank is rammus, the best crowd control tank is blitzcrank, the best utility tank is maokai, the best offensive tank is leona, the best defensive tank is shen, the best anti-magic tank is galio, the best anti-physical tank is malphite, the best flanker tank is poppy, the best mobile fortress tank is sejuani, the best engage tank is zac, the best dueler tank is jarvan.

those are the only champions classified by riot as tanks in the client.

in the case of catfish breath - he's classified as a support. my opinion is that taric, braum, and rakan are better at tanking than kench. the reason being is that kench's bubble shield does not regenerate a large amount of HP or prevent damage for more than 2 seconds. more so his abilities do not scale with armor, magic resist, or HP. at least taric and braum scale with armor. i however cant remember if kench has an HP variable in one of his stats or not. i feel like he might.

regardless - due to the simple fact that kench is a support first and foremost he's going to automatically fall flat in the tanking aspect. though as a support that shields his allies with his own body he brings a lot to the table. if your friend means tahm is the most hp regenerating support then yes he's correct.

Tahms autos used to scale with his max HP as a passive on his ult.  I remember that getting changed, and I can't remember if it merely got reduced or was removed entirely.

Personally, I believe support is a position and not a role, so I would happily classify Braum and Tahm as tanks (just like Leona, who is a bot-lane support)

The argument for Tahm being the tankiest is that he can potentially have near double health in an all-in.  Other than that he doesn't really get anything else defensively added to his kit.  It depends on who you are fighting against on the enemy team as to who the tankiest champion would be.  If against a heavy AD team it is probably Rammus or Malphite because they scale off of armor and can afford to strictly stack it.  If against a lot of magic damage, Galio would be by far the tankiest being able to get massive amounts of % damage reduction from his W as well as a magic shield.  As some others have stated, Tryndamere could potentially be the tankiest in some situations because of his ult.  Against some champions like Vayne and Master Yi, it doesn't matter how much resistances you have which would put Tryndamere at the top for tankiness.

Tahm is lots of fun and can indeed be really powerful.... however Tahm support is also somewhat situational.... in that most of his power comes from his ally W allowing him to save allies from being picked up and protect the carries from being bursted/assassinated
However it isn't very effective against DPS champions or AoE and it also has the weakness of preventing the ally from attacking or casting abilities which effectively removes the ally from the fight for a short while

Tahm also has the obvious weakness of only having a single target slow (though it is a pretty powerful slow) so he has no way of quickly interrupting enemies and his lack of AoE CC/utility can make his teamfighting a lot weaker then other supports

Though he does have surprisingly high single target damage (well not like he has any AoE) so if he goes for a somewhat selfish build he can be quite troublesome to deal with for immobile carries because of his high durability and repeated stuns and increased passive damage when he is able to get 3 stacks and stick to a target
